channel.title: Mike Eee on Super.NET Blog, Dawg
channel.description: Recent content in Mike Eee on Super.NET Blog, Dawg

item.title: About
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Welcome to the Super.NET blog. Here you will find updates to thoughts and discussions around Super.NET. Whereas the primary Super.NET site is meant more for establishing vision and explanatory purposes, this site is mostly for the information and/or thoughts that have occurred after that site was initially created and published.

item.title: Culture of Excellence
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. The Final Chapter In our final section here, we examine the ideal culture that we want to build around the philosophy that is being described here.

item.title: Simple Does It
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. As I mentioned in describing software as a craft, I have been going through a very inspirational time with putting this project together.

item.title: Business of Art
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. Having explored software as a craft, we can now explore a few aspects of art as a business and the challenges it faces as such.

item.title: Software as a Craft
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. In the philosophy that is described here, it proposes that software development is a craft, much like wood working, pottery, beer, or – as this section later calls out – jewelry.

item.title: Aspire to Inspire
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. The Need for Inspiration In my estimation, the primary issue with our .NET client development ecosystem is that of inspiration.

item.title: Soul Space
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. Quick Word on Value Judgments Before diving into the subject, I think it’s appropriate to have a quick word on what might be perceived as value judgements within my communication.

item.title: The Customer Is Not Always Right
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: This is an article on the topic of philosophy in software, business, and life. “The Customer is Always Right” We hear this a lot in business, and perhaps our culture.

item.title: Philosophy
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: What’s Up with Philosophy in a Tech Blog, Dawg? Fair question. I myself do like to keep concerns separated, much like my software design. Perhaps my thoughts here are better expressed in a personal blog.

item.title: MSFT vs MS
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)

item.title: Hello World: Welcome to Super.NET Blog, Dawg
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Welcome to the Super.NET Blog, Dawg! Here, you will find supplemental resources for the Super.NET main site, as well as the archive for the now-retired “Developers.win!” Built with Hugo I have been spending some time with Hugo in designing this site, and I have been nothing short of being completely and utterly impressed.

item.title: Who is Agent Smith?
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: While running Developers Win! last year I’d like to say, I made contact with a developer in the comments of one of my posts that I would classify is part of the dark matter, and have assigned the name Agent Smith.
